guide.introduction: This How To will guide you through a step by step process into making a Ruben's Table, or a modified version of the Ruben's Tube. Watch
guide.introduction_rendered: This How To will guide you through a step by step process into making a Ruben's Table, or a modified version of the Ruben's Tube. Watch

lines.text: Before we get started, we should list the safety guidelines we are going to follow, to assure a safe project:
lines.text_raw: Before we get started, we should list the safety guidelines we are going to follow, to assure a safe project:

lines.text: Conditions: We will have open flames and propane gas. We need to make sure that materials in contact or near these can handle those conditions
lines.text_raw: Conditions: We will have open flames and propane gas. We need to make sure that materials in contact or near these can handle those conditions

lines.text: The flames can be quite hot, but they are actually above the surface of the box. The metal below the flame is expected to reach about 200 degrees F.
lines.text_raw: The flames can be quite hot, but they are actually above the surface of the box. The metal below the flame is expected to reach about 200 degrees F.

lines.text: The top of the box is made of aluminium, and should be fine at this temperature
lines.text_raw: The top of the box is made of aluminium, and should be fine at this temperature

lines.text: The box needs to be sealed.
lines.text_raw: The box needs to be sealed.

lines.text: peter says: (1) running a flame effect at full tank pressure will cause too much fire. u absolutely need a regulator. (2) You also need a quarter turn safety cutoff. (3) The top of the my Ruben's tube runs at about 200 degrees F (4) make sure you soap-test all connections (5) have moist towels handy (6) nitrile glove to make diaphragm (7) make sure no leaks around glove and speaker (8) 3M barrier Sealant CP 25WBB has a "service temperature range of -20 degrees to +180 degrees F (9) use buna-n tubing as gasket (e.g. from mcmaster carr)

lines.text: (10) don't use wood: it absorbs propane and becomes extremely flammable (11) wood is porous to propane (12) a metal box would be safe
